text: Renato Sellani (8 January 1926 â€“ 31 October 2014) was an Italian jazz pianist and composer. As a pianist, he worked with Chet Baker, Billie Holiday, Dizzie Gillespie, Lee Konitz, Bill Coleman, Gerry Mulligan, Enrico Rava and Tony Scott, among others. He was born in Senigallia, Province of Ancona. Sellani died in Milan, Italy, aged 88. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Italian jazz musicians Category:People from Marche Category:Italian pianists Category:20th-century Italian composers Category:21st-century Italian composers
title: Renato Sellani
